results.name: Number of ways to write n = x + y with 0 < x <= y such that 2^x * y + 1 is prime.
comment: Conjecture: (i) a(n) > 0 for all n > 1. Also, any integer n > 1 can be written as x + y (x, y > 0) with 2^x * y^2 + 1 prime.
(ii) Each integer n > 2 can be written as x + y (x, y > 0) with 2^x * y - 1 prime. Also, every n = 3, 4, ... can be expressed as x + y (x, y > 0) with 2^x * y^2 - 1 prime.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4000
